meta.description: Whitelist pack manifest: recommended file boundaries, lazy-load order, and rule consumers.
meta.usage_rules_top:
USAGE RULES (READ FIRST)
1) Do NOT apply any list as a global replace. Always apply via a context rule (pattern/gate) first.
2) Apply multi-word phrases BEFORE single-word matching.
3) Preserve existing correct casing; only upgrade casing (lower → Title Case / UPPER) when a rule triggers.
4) Prefer "places" over "people names" (names cause false positives: May/Will/Rose/Mark/etc.).
5) British English default (en-GB). No Oxford comma enforcement via these lists.
6) Lists are whitelists only; they do not imply the text is correct or that punctuation should be inserted.
7) Version these files. If filename changes (e.g., v1→v2), browsers will refetch; otherwise rely on cache.
meta.usage_rules_bottom:
REMINDER
- Context-gate every application.
- Multi-word phrases first.
- Avoid applying given-names list unless explicitly enabled (experimental) or title/direct-address gated.

notes: Keep people_given_names disabled by default to avoid false positives (May/Will/Rose/etc.).
Apply phrase lists before token lists.
Prefer places lists over names lists.
